DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC Edition 8 Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group based on the combination of T, N, and M categories and relevant prognostic factors for colon and rectal neuroendocrine tumor, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A well differentiated, low or intermediate grade tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the colon or rectum._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A well differentiated, low or intermediate grade tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the colon or rectum.

Concepts.definition: A well differentiated, low, intermediate, or high grade neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the colon or rectum.

Property.preferredDefinition: Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.definition: An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System

ValueDomain.preferredName: Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A term that refers to the staging of a colorectal neuroendocrine tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to colorectal "carcinoid" tumors (neuroendocrine tumor G1 and G2, and rare-well differentiated G3). High-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas and mixed adenoneuroendocrine carcinomas of the colon and rectum are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IV Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IV Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IV includes: (T1, Any N, M1); (T2, Any N, M1); (T3, Any N, M1); (T4, Any N, M1). T1: Tumor invading the lamina propria or submucosa and measuring 2 cm or less. T2: Tumor invading the muscularis propria or measuring more than 2 cm with invasion of the lamina propria or submucosa. T3: Tumor invading through the muscularis propria into subserosal tissue without penetration of overlying serosa. T4: Tumor invading the visceral peritoneum (serosa) or other organs or adjacent structures. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IV includes: (T1, Any N, M1); (T2, Any N, M1); (T3, Any N, M1); (T4, Any N, M1). T1: Tumor invading the lamina propria or submucosa and measuring 2 cm or less. T2: Tumor invading the muscularis propria or measuring more than 2 cm with invasion of the lamina propria or submucosa. T3: Tumor invading through the muscularis propria into subserosal tissue without penetration of overlying serosa. T4: Tumor invading the visceral peritoneum (serosa) or other organs or adjacent structures. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IIIB Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IIIB Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIB includes: (T1, N1, M0); (T2, N1, M0); (T3, N1, M0); (T4, N1, M0). T1: Tumor invading the lamina propria or submucosa and measuring 2 cm or less. T2: Tumor invading the muscularis propria or measuring more than 2 cm with invasion of the lamina propria or submucosa. T3: Tumor invading through the muscularis propria into subserosal tissue without penetration of overlying serosa. T4: Tumor invading the visceral peritoneum (serosa) or other organs or adjacent structures. N1: Regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIB Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIB includes: (T1, N1, M0); (T2, N1, M0); (T3, N1, M0); (T4, N1, M0). T1: Tumor invading the lamina propria or submucosa and measuring 2 cm or less. T2: Tumor invading the muscularis propria or measuring more than 2 cm with invasion of the lamina propria or submucosa. ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IIIA Colorectal Neuroendocrine Tumor AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIA includes: T4, N0, M0. T4: Tumor invading the visceral peritoneum (serosa) or other organs or adjacent structures. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIB includes: T3, N0, M0. T3: Tumor invading through the muscularis propria into subserosal tissue without penetration of overlying serosa. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage I includes: T1, N0, M0. T1: Tumor invading the lamina propria or submucosa and measuring 2 cm or less. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)
